comment.body:
> @baentsch any idea why?

Well yes: The error message:

> lstat /root/project/docker/Dockerfile: no such file or directory

says the Dockerfile is no longer where it's expected by `.circleci/config.yml`:

https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs-go/blob/28be2ce91ace968370f3f04b38d2128b160396c0/.circleci/config.yml#L99

But once the github based code added in #20 runs OK you may simply want to remove the old docker build code completely from CircleCI. Sorry for not spotting this in review. See #22 for what I mean.

Please work with @SamYuan1990 to completely resolve this as I'm heading out to vacation in a few minutes. I'm sure @xvzcf could also help.

issue.title: Size optimization ngtcp2
issue.body:
Hi,
I have refactored the Dockerfiles for ngtcp2 to use multi-stage build. This reduces the size of each docker image to ∼32 MB.

Thank you for reviewing!

comment.body: Thanks for this PR and optimization, @Keelan10 . Unfortunately, I'm heading out to vacation in a few minutes, so can I ask @xvzcf  to take a look? Please also consider moving this to use OpenSSL3+oqsprovider as per #182.

issue.title: Add h2load to oqs-demos
issue.body:
Hi, I integrated OQS-OpenSSL-QUIC into h2load benchmarking tool and provided a Dockerfile to fully automate the integration.

Thanks for reviewing!

comment.body: Thanks again for the contribution but the same comment here: We really want to reduce the number of demos using the old `oqs-openssl111` based code as per https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/discussions/434. If you'd have the time to move things over to use OpenSSL3+oqsprovider that'd be great. Again tagging @xvzcf for attention during my absence.

issue.title: Removed dependency on internal ssltestlib
issue.body:
This PR hopefully solves "Remove dependency on internal OpenSSL test harness #137".

- I made sure only public OSSL APIs are used in the TLS test helper functions
- TLS 1.3 handshake is used 
- Removed support for DTLS to remove unnecessary dependency (I assume the specific transport protocol is less relevant for PQC tests)
- Tested on OSSL 3.0 and 3.1 branches 

Please let me know your thoughts,
Thanks,
Alex

P.S. I believe dependency on libtestutil can also be removed.

comment.body: @alexzas fyi, I'll be heading to vacation in a few minutes, so I'm asking @bhess and @xvzcf to help moving your contribution(s) through to merge.

issue.title: Upgrade to OpenSSL3
issue.body: As per https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/discussions/434#discussioncomment-5421852 switching another downstream project. Performance impacts of this will be interesting to observe (see also https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/1431 necessitating further updates to downstream projects)

comment.body: @xvzcf @dstebila Please merge if you feel comfortable dealing in my absence with a possible "fallout" from this change: Performance numbers may change wildly as result.

issue.title: Update httpd to OpenSSL3
issue.body:
PR done such as to easily apply after #191 gets merged.

CI problem remaining: OpenSSH doesn't pass any more: @christianpaquin @dstebila @xvzcf : Could one of you maybe take a look as to what's the (apparently new) problem with that? Otherwise, I'd suggest also removing `openssh` from the supported demos list just like `haproxy` until someone has time & interest to fully support it again.

comment.body: Same here: I'm merge this as-is right away, but won't be around if sth breaks in consequence; thus, leave merging to you @dstebila @xvzcf

issue.title: Size optimization ngtcp2
issue.body:
Hi,
I have refactored the Dockerfiles for ngtcp2 to use multi-stage build. This reduces the size of each docker image to ∼32 MB.

Thank you for reviewing!

comment.body: @SamYuan1990 Please check the (remaining ) error message: There seems to be something fishy with the build-image instruction added in #20: https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs-go/actions/runs/4685702520/jobs/8303055705?pr=22

> @SamYuan1990 Please check the (remaining ) error message: There seems to be something fishy with the build-image instruction added in #20: https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs-go/actions/runs/4685702520/jobs/8303055705?pr=22 you know as I [said](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs-go/pull/20#issuecomment-1483799310) @baentsch , please ask who has maintainer role to fix it as https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs-go/blob/main/.github/workflows/PRcheck.yml#L29 in this PR it requires environment vars. and share with my fork settings.

issue.title: Initial fetching of MD and Cipher objects from OpenSSL(3)
issue.body:
We need init them and free them in one place to avoid threading issues.

<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider), [OQS-OpenSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl), [OQS-BoringSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl), and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

comment.body: Hi @beldmit , would it make sense to replace EVP_aes_256_ecb() in src/common/rand/rand_nist.c?
